results.title: The Fast Track
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, Ken Chown, Granada International Productions and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
The Minister for Enterprise has a pet Bicentennial project: he wants to build the fastest train in the world, to service marginal electorates on its run from Sydney to Canberra. Businessmen and lobbyists share his enthusiasm for the supertrain but his Department head has reservations which the Press and the Parliamentary Opposition are keen to exploit! Moderator: Geoffrey Robertson.

results.title: The Farmer was a fighting man
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Movietonenews
results.brief_description: A description of the extensive operations undertaken by Commonwealth and State authorities to prepare large tracts of country for the establishment of farms for ex-servicemen of World War II. Shows clearing and land reclamation in Western Australia, South Australia, Tasmania and at Loxton on the River Murray.

results.title: The Farmer's daughter
results.creator_credit: H C Potter, Dore Schary and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: Katie Holmstrom (Loretta Young in an Oscar winning performance) leaves her farm seeking a nursing career in Capitol City. She accepts a ride with sign-painter Adolph Petree, but a car accident forces them to spend a night at a motel while repairs are undertaken. Katie helps pay for damages and arrives in the City penniless. She works as a maid in the Morley household and impresses the Congressman and his family. Morley runs for re-election and wins, but his colleague dies soon after taking office, and the party nominates a political hack named Finley to replace him. Katie is furious, tells off Finley at a rally, drawing so much attention that the rival party drafts her as its darkhorse candidate, building her campaign on her refreshing honesty and openness. However, someone she once helped turns on her and threatens her new position. Co-starring Joseph Cotten, Ethel Barrymore, Charles Bickford and Rose Hobart. Adapted from the play Hulda: Daughter of Parliament by Juhni Tervata.

results.title: The Farmer
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatises the daily activities of a teenager and his young brother and sister, the children of a typical American farmer in the Midwest. The film pictures the farm as a modern, inviting, pleasant place on which to work and live.

results.title: The Farm factory
results.brief_description: How the work of a typical British farm is organised, how the yearly production schedule, the marketing of the farm products, and the daily life and work in a rural community is carried out. Commentary by John Morgan.

results.title: The Farm
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Bill Hughes, ABC-TV (Australia) and Burberry Productions
results.brief_description: Miniseries about the harsh realities of farming in Australia during the 1980s and one family’s battle against economic and climatic odds. It is 1985 and prolonged drought and high interest rates have meant that sheep farmers Tom and Liz Cooper (Colin Friels and Greta Scacchi) can no longer meet the repayments on their foreign currency loan. The bank threatens to foreclose and the couple decides to sue them to save their property. It’s a seven-year battle that tests the family’s fortitude against the bank’s corporate might. Filmed on location in the sheep country near Yass, “The Farm” tackles issues which are still relevant to farmers today such as farm succession, economic rationalism, corporatisation and the perceived uncaring nature of government policy.

results.title: The Farm
results.brief_description: A photographic meditation on the family farm. This was 13 year old David’s first attempt to create anything using multimedia. It is a simple slideshow, but his presentation of his beloved family farm in all its moods reveals a connection to and feeling for place that is unmistakable.

results.title: The Fang
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Fang is an animation that uses the animated contributions of past AIM students. Produced and directed by Al MacInnes with the song performed by his band Dan and Al, the Fang celebrates and displays the vast animation techniques and styles used by Al’s peers. The Fang himself is a character around town who wonders what the fang is and discovers that he is the fang, a very much sort after man.

results.title: The Fan
results.creator_credit: Edward Bianchi, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller starring Lauren Bacall as the glamorous Broadway actress, Sally Ross. Sally has many adoring fans but amusement turns into terror when she becomes the obsession of one young man who is prepared to go to any lengths to realise his ultimate fantasy. Cast also includes James Garner, Maureen Stapleton, Hector Elizondo and Michael Biehn as “the fan”. Based upon the novel by Bob Randall.
